verses.verse: Praise to God for His Word and Providence Praise the LORD! For (Ex. 15:18; Ps. 10:16; (Rev. 11:15)) it is good to sing praises to our God; (Ps. 92:1) For it is pleasant, and (Ps. 135:3) praise is beautiful.
The LORD (Ps. 33:1) builds up Jerusalem; (Ps. 102:16) He gathers together the outcasts of Israel.
(Deut. 30:3; Is. 11:12; 56:8; Ezek. 39:28) He heals the brokenhearted And binds up their wounds.
((Ps. 51:17); Is. 61:1; Luke 4:18) He counts the number of the stars; He calls them all by name.
(Is. 40:26) Great is our Lord, and (Ps. 48:1) mighty in power; (Nah. 1:3) His understanding is infinite.
(Is. 40:28) The LORD lifts up the humble; He casts the wicked down to the ground.
Sing to the LORD with thanksgiving; Sing praises on the harp to our God,
(Ps. 146:8, 9) Who covers the heavens with clouds, Who prepares rain for the earth, Who makes grass to grow on the mountains.
(Job 38:26; Ps. 104:13) He gives to the beast its food, And (Job 38:41) to the young ravens that cry.
((Matt. 6:26)) He does not delight in the strength of the horse; He takes no pleasure in the legs of a man.
The LORD takes pleasure in those who fear Him, In those who hope in His mercy.
Praise the LORD, O Jerusalem! Praise your God, O Zion!
For He has strengthened the bars of your gates; He has blessed your children within you.
(Ps. 33:16, 17) He makes peace in your borders, And (Is. 54:13; 60:17, 18) fills you with the finest wheat.
(Ps. 132:15) He sends out His command to the earth; His word runs very swiftly.
((Ps. 107:20)) He gives snow like wool; He scatters the frost like ashes;
He casts out His hail like morsels; Who can stand before His cold?
(Job 37:6) He sends out His word and melts them; He causes His wind to blow, and the waters flow.
(Job 37:10) He declares His word to Jacob, (Deut. 33:4; Ps. 103:7) His statutes and His judgments to Israel.
(Mal. 4:4) He has not dealt thus with any nation; And as for His judgments, they have not known them. Praise the LORD!
